Annotated Time War

When Red wins

"Look on my works, ye mighty, and despair!"
Ozymandias - Percy Shelley
I met a traveller from an antique land,
Who saidâ€”"Two vast and trunkless legs of stone
Stand in the desert. . . . Near them, on the sand,
Half sunk a shattered visage lies, whose frown,
And wrinkled lip, and sneer of cold command,
Tell that its sculptor well those passions read
Which yet survive, stamped on these lifeless things,
The hand that mocked them, and the heart that fed;
And on the pedestal, these words appear:
My name is Ozymandias, King of Kings;
Look on my Works, ye Mighty, and despair!
Nothing beside remains. Round the decay
Of that colossal Wreck, boundless and bare
The lone and level sands stretch far away."

This poem is referenced absolutely everywhere. It's a reminder that all power, no matter how great, is only temporary.
"less a game of Go"
Go, A very complex game with 2*10170 possible board states (for reference the number of stars in the observable universe is 7*1022)
"than a game of tic-tac-toe"
War Games
If both players play optimally the inevitable conclusion of tic-tac-toe is a draw. Or the only winning move is not to play.

A glass jar

"in defiance of proverbs"
that is: 'a watched pot never boils'
"READ BY BUBBLING"
it turns out that it's in fact possible to boil water via MRI. Heating is in its essence applying enough energy to make the molecules vibrate faster. Energy application can be done via magnetic field (think induction stove)
"future shines so bright I gotta wear shades"
The Future's So Bright - Timbuk 3
Things are going great, and they're only getting better
I'm doing all right, getting good grades
The future's so bright, I gotta wear shades
"vast and trunkless legs of stone"
Ozymandias - Percy Shelley
Ozymandias again! Red is reading the overanthologized literature of the early Strand 6 nineteenth century that Blue recommends.
